<Link id="l04508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4508"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4509"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (ll &#42; rl) - (((lh &amp; rl) + (ll &amp; rh)) &lt;&lt; 64)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5357"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Called after matching a vector shuffle against a particular pattern.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5358"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both the original shuffle and the pattern have two vector operands.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5359"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OpNos&#91;0&#93; is the operand of the original shuffle that should be used for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operand 0 of the pattern, or -1 if operand 0 of the pattern can be anything.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5361"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OpNos&#91;1&#93; is the same for operand 1 of the pattern.  Resolve these -1s and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// set OpNo0 and OpNo1 to the shuffle operands that should actually be used</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5363"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for operands 0 and 1 of the pattern.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5364" lineLink="#a271038b4fbc1be6bbe65e08299187c48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a271038b4fbc1be6bbe65e08299187c48">chooseShuffleOpNos</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;OpNos, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;OpNo0, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;OpNo1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5365"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OpNos&#91;0&#93; &lt; 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5366"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OpNos&#91;1&#93; &lt; 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5367"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5368"><Highlight kind="normal">    OpNo0 = OpNo1 = OpNos&#91;1&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5369"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OpNos&#91;1&#93; &lt; 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5370"><Highlight kind="normal">    OpNo0 = OpNo1 = OpNos&#91;0&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5371"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5372"><Highlight kind="normal">    OpNo0 = OpNos&#91;0&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5373"><Highlight kind="normal">    OpNo1 = OpNos&#91;1&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5374"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5375"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5376"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5377"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5378"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Bytes is a VPERM-like permute vector, except that -1 is used for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5379"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// undefined bytes.  Return true if the VPERM can be implemented using P.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5380"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When returning true set OpNo0 to the VPERM operand that should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5381"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// used for operand 0 of P and likewise OpNo1 for operand 1 of P.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5382"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5383"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, if swapping the VPERM operands allows P to match, OpNo0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5384"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will be 1 and OpNo1 will be 0  If instead Bytes only refers to one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5385"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operand, but rewriting it to use two duplicated operands allows it to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5386"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// match P, then OpNo0 and OpNo1 will be the same.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5387" lineLink="#a57d318b65d3aefdda0babe2508402d55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a57d318b65d3aefdda0babe2508402d55">matchPermute</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;Bytes, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Permute &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5388"><Highlight kind="normal">                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;OpNo0, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;OpNo1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5389"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OpNos&#91;&#93; = &#123; -1, -1 &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5390"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = 0; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> &lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemz/#a8100b30b39f455a1b99d9d421a5b8f3b">SystemZ::VectorBytes</a>; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5391"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Elt = Bytes&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5392"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Elt &gt;= 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5393"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure that the two permute vectors use the same suboperand</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5394"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// byte number.  Only the operand numbers (the high bits) are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5395"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allowed to differ.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5396"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((Elt ^ <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>.Bytes&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>&#93;) &amp; (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemz/#a8100b30b39f455a1b99d9d421a5b8f3b">SystemZ::VectorBytes</a> - 1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5397"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5398"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ModelOpNo = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>.Bytes&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>&#93; / <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemz/#a8100b30b39f455a1b99d9d421a5b8f3b">SystemZ::VectorBytes</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5399"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RealOpNo = unsigned(Elt) / <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemz/#a8100b30b39f455a1b99d9d421a5b8f3b">SystemZ::VectorBytes</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5400"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure that the operand mappings are consistent with previous</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5401"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// elements.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5402"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OpNos&#91;ModelOpNo&#93; == 1 - RealOpNo)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5403"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5404"><Highlight kind="normal">      OpNos&#91;ModelOpNo&#93; = RealOpNo;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5405"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5406"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5407"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#a271038b4fbc1be6bbe65e08299187c48">chooseShuffleOpNos</a>(OpNos, OpNo0, OpNo1);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l06083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6083"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are three cases here:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6084"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6085"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if the only defined element is a loaded one, the best sequence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6086"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   is a replicating load.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6087"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6088"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - otherwise, if the only defined element is an i64 value, we will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6089"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   end up with the same VLVGP sequence regardless of whether we short-cut</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6090"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   for replication or fall through to the later code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6091"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6092"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - otherwise, if the only defined element is an i32 or smaller value,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6093"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   we would need 2 instructions to replicate it: VLVGP followed by VREPx.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6094"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   This is only a win if the single defined element is used more than once.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6095"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   In other cases we&#39;re better off using a single VLVGx.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l10126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10126"><Highlight kind="comment">   The rounding method is in FPC Byte 3 bits 6-7, and has the following</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10127"><Highlight kind="comment">   settings:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10128"><Highlight kind="comment">     0 Round to nearest</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10129"><Highlight kind="comment">     1 Round to 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10130"><Highlight kind="comment">     10 Round to +inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10131"><Highlight kind="comment">     11 Round to -inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10132"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10133"><Highlight kind="comment">  FLT&#95;ROUNDS, on the other hand, expects the following:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10134"><Highlight kind="comment">    -1 Undefined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10135"><Highlight kind="comment">     0 Round to 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10136"><Highlight kind="comment">     1 Round to nearest</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10137"><Highlight kind="comment">     2 Round to +inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10138"><Highlight kind="comment">     3 Round to -inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l10139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10139"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
